1123356305589186562.text:
This type of hoax really shows the effectiveness of this strategy.

Publish fake website → translate it →  publish it to a blog and/or email out a release →  wait for it to get picked up

This particular network has been at it for at least 2 years.https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/janelytvynenko/fake-schiff-release …

1123438905477480448.text: Same data commissioner who Facebook CEO tried to drop in on last month but she had other plans. Everyone is looking to Ireland to follow GDPR and push Facebook to be compliant. Not many think it is. Making this clear would help US worries about Duopoly abusing regulation.https://twitter.com/jason_kint/status/1123437472032149504 …

1123417914198110208.text: Is someone going to tell him the reputation issue isn’t just about privacy at this point? “I know we don’t exactly have the strongest reputation on privacy right now to put it lightly.”

1123442349936390144.text: Multiple people have asked me what happened with Google’s quarterly earnings. I haven’t had time to dig in but at surface note the significant decline in their Europe growth. And that’s despite Google’s blatant abuse of industry during GDPR roll-out.pic.twitter.com/En3pWbAJ7N

1123403960977625090.text: Exactly why new laws like GDPR which align data rights with consumer expectations by requiring narrow, specific and informed consent are a larger problem for Facebook than they let on.
